To operate various programs enhancing the capacity of developing countries universities and contributing to the local community by meeting local demands.

Government officials and village leaders are invited to Korea and learn about agricultural village/local development theories, have on-site trainings and make action plans, in order to make a self-reliant local community.

To help strengthen the e-Learning capacity and bridge the digital divide in partner countries by building and supporting the management of the Innovative ICT-based Pilot Classroom integrated with accumulated e-learning experience and know-how of Korea
Through Saemaul Undong, villagers of developing countries can enhance their self-reliance, increase income and develop their local community.

Information Access Center (IAC) is a Multi-functional facility that includes ICT Training Lab, ICT Complex Room, Seminar Room, and Administrative office. NIA provides IT infrastructure equipped with the newest PCs, A/Vs, O/As. etc, along with the general interior design/ construction of the center through the IAC Project. The Project aims to offer local communities a wide range of opportunities for ICT enablement and to bring them into Information Society, thus contributing to bridging the Global Digital Divide.

Aimed to bridge the digital divide and strengthen teacher & students' ICT in education capacities through the use of a digital classroom powered by solar panels which are immediately applicable in environments that lack sustainable electricity and educational infrastructure, in addition to local and international teacher training programmes led by Korean and international ICT in education specialists

This project aims to boosted job prospects and decrease in skill mismatches, provide quality occupation,  enhance the relevance between labor market and TVET, and improve the conditions of life-long education in the beneficiary countries. The project has put TVET in the spotlight, highlighting its importance as a vehicle to address youth unemployment and support both social and economic development in the countries and in the region more broadly.

establishment of cooperation network, development and operation of teacher education programs, review of teacher education environment of partner universities and exploration of possible areas for cooperation
